squander.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to carelessly waste money, time, opportunities etc
squander.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The home team squandered a number of chances in the first half.
They squandered the profits on expensive cars.
squander.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to spend money or use your time carelessly on things that are not useful
squander.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The bank squandered $500 million playing the U.S. bond market.
